The photograph accompanying your May 29 front-page article ''Central Park Keepers Struggling to Balance Masses With Grasses'' shows a lush green lawn guarded by an ugly fence. There must be a middle ground between a littered dust bowl and this overregulated, partitioned park created by the Central Park Conservancy.

When I first came to New York in the 1960's, people were afraid to enter Central Park night or day. The Lindsay administration deserves credit for encouraging people to use the park, allowing activities that brought people to the park, where they found safety in numbers. The park of today, as shaped by the conservancy, may be beautiful, but it is in danger of being sterile, homogenized and joyless, the lovely landscape marred by the barriers around it.
